DOC.brief_summary: Total Hip Arthroplasty is equal to or better than Hemiarthroplasty in the treatment of displaced femoral neck fractures in the elderly-elderly
DOC.brief_title: Hemiarthroplasty Compared to Total Hip Arthroplasty for Displaced Femoral Neck Fractures in the Elderly-elderly
DOC.detailed_description: Total Hip Arthroplasty is equal to or better alternative to Hemiarthroplasty in the treatment of displaced femoral neck fractures in the elderly-elderly (patients 80 years and over).
DOC.criteria: Acute displaced femoral neck fracture of hip (Garden classification 34) Independent walker with or without walking aides Patient willing to participate in the study and give written consent. Fracture older than 36 hours before admission Osteoarthritis in the fractured hip Rheumatoid arthritis in the fractured hip Pathological fractures Contraindication for hip arthroplasty surgery Not suitable for inclusion for other reasons e.g. substance abuse
